com.se.simplicity.vector
Class SimpleVectorf4

java.lang.Object
  com.se.simplicity.vector.ArrayBackedObjectf
      com.se.simplicity.vector.SimpleVectorf4
All Implemented Interfaces:
Vectorf, java.io.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
SimpleRGBColourVectorf4, SimpleTranslationVectorf4
public class SimpleVectorf4
extends ArrayBackedObjectf
implements Vectorf, java.io.Serializable

A 4 dimensional vector that stores its data in a float array.

Author:
Gary Buyn
See Also:

add

public void add(Vectorf vector)
Description copied from interface: Vectorf

Adds the Vectorf given to this Vectorf.

This Vectorf becomes the result of the addition.

This method assumes both Vectorfs to be homogenised.

Specified by:
add in interface Vectorf
Parameters:
vector - The Vectorf to add this Vectorf to.

addCopy

public Vectorf addCopy(Vectorf vector)
Description copied from interface: Vectorf

Adds the Vectorf given to this Vectorf.

A new Vectorf is created as the result of the addition.

This method assumes both Vectorfs to be homogenised.

Specified by:
addCopy in interface Vectorf
Parameters:
vector - The Vectorf to add this Vectorf to.
Returns:
A new Vectorf that is the result of sum of this Vectorf and the Vectorf given.

public void crossProductRight(Vectorf vector)
Description copied from interface: Vectorf

Performs a cross product of this Vectorf and the Vectorf given. The Vectorf given is placed on the right hand side of the equation.

This Vectorf becomes the result of the cross product.

This method assumes both Vectorfs to be homogenised.

homogenize

public void homogenize()
Description copied from interface: Vectorf

Homogenises this Vectorf.

Scales all values equally so that the w value of this Vectorf is 1.0f.

Specified by:
homogenize in interface Vectorf

multiplyLeft

public void multiplyLeft(Matrixf matrix)
Description copied from interface: Vectorf

Multiplies this Vectorf with the Matrixf given. This Vectorf is treated as a column vector and multiplied as follows: 

 ----------------     -----
  x | x | x | x |  *  | x |
 ----------------     -----
  x | x | x | x |     | x |
 ----------------     -----
  x | x | x | x |     | x |
 ----------------     -----
  x | x | x | x |     | x |
 ----------------     -----

This Vectorf becomes the result of the multiplication.

Specified by:
multiplyLeft in interface Vectorf
Parameters:
matrix - The Matrixf to be placed on the left hand side of the equation.

multiplyRight

public void multiplyRight(Matrixf matrix)
Description copied from interface: Vectorf

Multiplies this Vectorf with the Matrixf given. This Vectorf is treated as a row vector and multiplied as follows: 

 -----------------     -----------------
 | x | x | x | x |  *  | x | x | x | x |
 -----------------     -----------------
                       | x | x | x | x |
                       -----------------
                       | x | x | x | x |
                       -----------------
                       | x | x | x | x |
                       -----------------

This Vectorf becomes the result of the multiplication.

multiplyRight in interface Vectorf
Parameters:
